channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [FLINK-3432] ZookeeperOffsetHandlerTest fails on windows
item.description:

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
GitHub user zentol opened a pull request:

https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/1664

FLINK-3432 Fixed ZookeeperOffsethandlerTest on Windows

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/zentol/flink 3425_test_failure_6

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/1664.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

This closes #1664

commit d5774fc3c092520685073ca64f192d6a0ca72d62
Author: zentol <s.motsu@web.de>
Date: 2016-02-18T08:36:23Z

FLINK-3432 Fixed ZookeeperOffsethandlerTest on Windows

Github user zentol commented on the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/1664#issuecomment-185741473

The mkdirs() command failed for me on Windows. While debugging i noticed that mkdirs provides no means of accessing the reason why it failed. Files.createDirectories() is supposed to be more explicit with errors, and ,surprisingly enough, succeeded where mkdirs failed right away.

During the failure i also got an NullPointerException in close() since brokers wasn't initialized, so i added a null check.

Github user StephanEwen commented on the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/1664#issuecomment-188911039

Looks good to my, +1 to merge

Github user tillrohrmann commented on the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/1664#issuecomment-191814477

Will merge it. Thanks for your contribution @zentol

Github user asfgit closed the pull request at:

https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/1664
